title: Arts, A/V Technology and Communications: Media Production
subject: CTE

678F6BB43F634B0A8FB9A20044B0126E.description:
Prepare finished production for distribution via desired delivery format
Examples: Render Final Media Production, Research the publishing formats available for your media, Evaluate the publish format for a specified end use of media, Publish media to external sources

70FB1C182F97488ABBC8041800C0797C.description:
Produce a Final Media Project Using an Editing Software
Examples: Combine all raw media footage, Insert Special Effects, Animation, Layer Audio, Visual Effects, Transition, Title Pages, Credit, Review and Edit for Corrections

75B6E136BB334AD2AA1744744284E12C.description:
Utilize Production Plan to Capture raw Media Footage
Examples: Prepare set (site location), cast, and equipment, Ensure proper lighting and sound, Record from multiple angles and takes

40149703076D4B96A33F1DC1DA641130.description:
Design and connect production plans, techniques, and roles
Examples: Brainstorm new ideas for a media project, Create a Script and Storyboard with a coherent theme, Evaluate/Revise Scripts and Storyboards, Analyze edited projects for shot composition and/or sound quality, Develop cast, director, props, locations, and sets

549017D04282452BB966F6D206859A49.description: Produce Media for Distribution using Phases of Production

720DB32D35FD4D47B0264D405D95CCD2.description:
Demonstrate skills and safety procedures used in video production
Examples: Select equipment based on a specific project, Demonstrate skills with specific pieces of equipment, Discuss basic equipment care, how to maintain batteries, use of auxiliary power, Discuss problems that occur in different production scenarios, Demonstrate safety practices for both operator and equipment

27C74C7E05F24AECA368F9590659845C.description: Exhibit basic skills in operating production equipment

F40719D7F16B4D8494E9B967E07A9B7D.description:
Evaluate information in the media
Examples: Distinguish role of society in media, Determine source credibility, Analyze the impact of print and television commercials

96ED35E5458B4708A815A0190606D10B.description:
Categorize Digital Media Communication
Examples: Compare differences in media, Explain media biases

84FBC9CE92BB42B1B7FE3BA81DD30BD4.description:
Evaluate Web-Based Social Networks
Examples: Distinguish differences in media delivery, Differentiate among fact finding sites, Critique numerous social media sites

57CF46F8C17C4D05957B7532D65BACB6.description:
Describe and Apply Principles of Media Law
Examples: Identify and apply principles of copyright, Explore the Federal Communications Commission’s (FCC) role in mass media, Predict consequences of media misuse, Role-play filmmaker explaining “informed consent” to subject

3C46C1A886D145C39F7F52B7C3E86FD0.description:
Demonstrate Employability Skills required by business and industry
Examples: Attendance and punctuality, Positive attitude, Positive work ethic, Use of Proper Social Skills, Display ability to work as part of a team and take direction from others

85EAE0DD3B5B4D0C92CC938F356ED342.description:
Investigate career opportunities, trends, and requirements related to media production careers
Examples: Research job opportunities, Investigate trends associated with media production, Discuss related career pathways

8C99AE62545F413DAF0E6503A3BC7A66.description:
Identify personal interests and abilities related to media production careers.
Examples: identify personal creative talents, identify technical/production talents

3B8B048BD307443FB510ABC96DB03806.description: Develop an Awareness of Career Opportunities and Professionalism in Media Production
